Name: Cut (Las Vegas)
Review: Best Wagu steak and Old Fashioned cocktail I've ever had

Name: Myrtle Tavern (Leeds)
Review: An exceptional gastropub. Quality food and great service!

Name: Noci (London)
Review: A bit underwhelming

Name: Veeraswamy (London)
Review: Nice tasting menu including lobster chicken and prawn.

Name: Giggling Squid (Chislehurst)
Review: Great decor and food & drink.

Name: Mowgli (Leeds)
Review: Good starters/sides, room for improvement with the mains. Cardamon Old Fashioned was great

Name: Jacuzzi (London)
Review: Decent food and decor, and 'The Golden Age' cocktail was amazing. However, the menu wasn't as extensive as I was expecting.

Name: Las Iguanas (Leeds)
Review: Good bottomless brunch with a variety of cocktails

Name: Cataplana LX (Lisbon)
Review: Came here a few days ago and got the mixed Paella (chicken & seafood) and it was very good!

Name: Come Prima (Lisbon)
Review: Nice Italian with homemade fresh food. Slightly cramped seating but great service.

Name: Breakfast Lovers (Lisbon)
Review: Great food and nice vibe. Nice twist to have eggs Benedict on croissant ü•ê

Name: Bono (Lisbon)
Review: Great service, cosy atmosphere and tasty food. Would recommend the creamy rice with pulled beef rib!

Name: Dear Breakfast (Lisbon)
Review: Decent food. Tried the halloumi pancake which was quite unique and nice. Would have preferred the fried eggs not to have any runny whites however.

Name: Crossroad10 (Lisbon)
Review: Nice food, although the menu was very small and the waiter wasn‚Äôt even sure what the dessert was

Name: Yakuza by Olivier (Lisbon)
Review: Very good food, although very pricey. Amazing decor and nice vibe inside.

Name: The Folks (Lisbon)
Review: Very good presentation of food and nice vibe. Wish we could have swapped the choice of bread free of charge however.

Name: Azzurra (London)
Review: It was ok, but very overpriced and gimicky. ¬£39 for some spaghetti and a single prawn. ¬£20 for some sorbet mixed with Prosecco and sold as a fancy 'cocktail'. And a ¬£15 Tiramisu made at the table just for show. We were disappointed to not be allowed to take the leftover food home in a box.

Name: House of Koko (Leeds)
Review: Food was amazing, particularly enjoyed the Moroccan Chicken Sandwhich. Great service and dog-friendly too!

Name: Took Took (London)
Review: Great food and atmosphere, and Rafi was an amazing waiter üëåüèΩ

Name: Cibus Pizza (Manchester)
Review: All 3 courses, drinks, and service were excellent üëè

Name: Jungle Brunch & Drinks (Albufeira)
Review: Painfully slow service. We had to get up multiple times to ask the staff to take our orders and when the food would be arriving. Average food.

Name: Casa Del Mar (Albufeira)
Review: Good food, views and service!

Name: Portugal Rocks Brunch Bar & Cafe (Albufeira)
Review: Good food and nice friendly staff, but overall a poor experience due to the extremely slow service. From being seated it took an hour to receive our food, and it wasn‚Äôt even busy.

Name: Mar√® (Lagos)
Review: A nice and affordable buffet for meat lovers in particular

Name: Wingmans (London)
Review: Very good Buffalo wings. Loaded Salt N Peppa Tots side not so good. 2 cocktails took atleast 15 mins to arrive.

Name: Cattleya (London)
Review: Nice, authentic Thai food. Impressive service from the single lady who was running the restaurant. Main tasted good but the noodles were stuck together. Starters were also good but would have expected some dips to be provided.

Name: Tharavadu (Leeds)
Review: Tasty food, but the miniscule portions were very disappointing. 3 prawns in a starter that cost almost ¬£10 was a bit of a joke.

Name: Som Saa (London)
Review: A unique Thai menu, albeit quite limited. Spicier than I was expecting. The cured prawns starter was literally completely raw prawns with the slightest hint of flavour.

Name: Trattoria Isolana (Turks & Caicos)
Review: Not bad but the Chicken Escalope was a bit basic.

Name: Provence By Eric (Turks & Caicos)
Review: A bit pretentious overall. Mains were decent. 'Burrata' starter was a bit of a joke. Chefs table experience was cool, but wish the chefs made more of an effort to speak to us, rather than only speaking to the guests who could speak French.

Name: Seven (Turks & Caicos)
Review: Nice chorizo Paella. Outdated decor and lots of empty tables brought down the ambience.

Name: Infiniti (Turks & Caicos)
Review: Fairly average food. Nice outdoor settings and ambience.

Name: Indigo (Turks & Caicos)
Review: Very good food. Appreciated that the head chef came to speak to us.

Name: Vita (Turks & Caicos)
Review: Nice lobster pizza and scenic views. A sticker label was left on a vegetable in the salad, but the staff were very apologetic and removed it from the bill.

Name: Oku (Nassau)
Review: Great sushi, cocktails, and nice vibes.

Name: 23¬∞ North (Exuma)
Review: Good starters, but steak was overcooked, searless, and came with some basic salad leaves only.

Name: Palapa (Exuma)
Review: Decent casual spot. Same 5 songs played on repeat non-stop.

Name: Mercer Roof Terrace (London)
Review: An exceptional Christmas meal. Well presented and tasty food. Good service and friendly staff.

Name: SMOKESTAK (London)
Review: Tasty brisket bun. Quite cramped space wise indoors, but they accomodated a walk-in without reservation during peak-hours which was nice.

Name: Devonshire Terrace by Drake & Morgan (London)
Review: Decent Christmas meal. Good braised ox-cheek.

Name: Flat Iron (Leeds)
Review: Great steak and very reasonable prices. The free popcorn and ice cream were nice touches. Should add Chimmichuri to the menu.

Name: Osteria Romana (London)
Review: Good authentic Italian food and big portion sizes. The carbonara was a little too salty (but that is somewhat to be expected with Guanciale based dishes). Reasonable prices given the Knightsbridge location. Complimentary Tiramisu dessert for our birthday celebration was a nice touch.

Name: Sushi & Momo Zone (London)
Review: Decent Sushi at affordable prices. Atmosphere/ambience was a little too quiet.

Name: Ambassadors Clubhouse (London)
Review: Decent, but overall quality of food not quite up to the standard of other JK restaurants such as Trishna. The curry was way too spicy with no option for a lower spice level. Cheeky to charge ¬£4 for raita which were offered to help with the spice and we assumed would be complimentary. Good portion sizes and lovely gulabjaman dessert. A great old fashioned cocktail. Nice decor & vibe.

Name: Trattoria Da Denis (Venice)
Review: An excellent carbonara with al dente spaghetti and the perfect creamy sauce. Panchetta was too thin however.

Name: Bo Osteria (Venice)
Review: Cute small restaurant with a chill vibe. However, I wasn't blown away by the gnocchi, was expecting actual pieces of Panchetta rather than grated flakes.

Name: Al Peoceto Risorto (Venice)
Review: Lasagne was decent but the pasta sheets could have been more al dente and the cheese on top more crispy. Nice cocktails and vibe.

Name: Dal Moro's (Venice)
Review: The carbonara cheese wheel was more for show and not authentic or particularly tasty. The cheese from the wheel was barely melted, so didn't result in an emulsified and creamy sauce. The chunky panchetta pieces were nice however. The chicken Caesar salad used cheap chunks of processed chicken and was too saucy for our liking. Generous sized cocktails. Cheeky to ask for 'optional' service charge, which felt too awkward to refuse, when table cover charge had already been added.

Name: La Piazzetta (Dolomites)
Review: Nice thin crust pizza with a unique hemp-based dough.

Name: Ristorante Amadeus (Dolomites)
Review: Good service. Nice Venison Ragu. Sole fish was nice, but quite cheeky to serve this completely on its own so we had to order potatoes and vegetables separately.

Name: Bar Chalet (Dolomites)
Review: Not the most helpful staff when it came to explaining menu items. Just a basic fast food spot at a popular tourist spot, so expectations weren't particularly high.

Name: Ristorante Pizzeria 5 Torri (Dolomites)
Review: Fast service and good portion sizes. Decent carbonara, but almost a bit too saucy and the Panchetta was thin and scarce.

Name: Pizzeria Edelweiss (Dolomites)
Review: Nice pizza and very reasonable prices. Enjoyed the coke on draught, which is not often seen around Italy.

Name: II Vizietto Di Cortina (Dolomites)
Review: Great service with unique complimentary gifts including a Ricotta & Jam starter and serving of Limoncello. The carbonara was authentic with it's use of guanciale, but I personally find this to be way too salty. The spaghetti on the other hand was a bit bland and unsalted, and the eggs had started to scramble slightly. Purple gnocchi was nice.

Name: Thai Corner (Manchester)
Review: Decent currys which pack a good level of heat.

Name: Fatpats (Manchester)
Review: Very tasty subs. Spenny but the sizeable subs are good for 2 meals to be fair.

Name: Sri Non Thai (Leeds)
Review: Good authentic Thai food. However, quite slow service and decor could do with some work.

Name: The Old Original Bakewell Pudding Shop (Bakewell)
Review: Was worried this place would be a bit of a tourist trap but it was actually surprisingly good. The open steak sandwich was great, and of course yummy Bakewell pudding and tarts too.

Name: Lovage by Lee Smith (Bakewell)
Review: A high quality and well presented tasting menu.

Name: Ad Maiora (Manchester)
Review: An authentic Italian sandwich shop serving fresh schiacciata. The Haaland and Inferno were both great, with their own unique flavour profiles. Could do with more seating and our table hadn't been cleaned.

Name: Madre (Manchester)
Review: Tasty Mexican Tapas with great atmosphere and decor. Loved the Birria tacos and crispy fried potatoes in particular.

Name: Gooey (Manchester)
Review: The french toast and cinnamon bun were excellent, accompanied by nice and fresh cold pressed juices. The 20 mins queue wasn't ideal and the decor and seating could be improved however.

Name: Caru' cu bere (Bucharest)
Review: Amazing indoor decor and decent food.

Name: The Mango Tree (Bucharest)
Review: Nice classy restaurant with good food at reasonable prices. Nonthaburi duck could have had a bit more of a heat kick to it.

Name: Mayfair 39 (Bucharest)
Review: An 'Instagrammable' brunch spot with surprisingly good food. The pistachio fluffy pancakes were excellent and the cr√®me sauce wasn't too thick nor sickly, as is often the case with desserts involving nut spreads.

Name: Cabana Paltinu (TransfƒÉgƒÉrƒÉ»ôan)
Review: Cute lodge vibes, but food was pretty average, and wine was poor.

Name: Cyurly-Burly (TransfƒÉgƒÉrƒÉ»ôan)
Review: A nice little find in a remote mountainous region, with friendly and humourous staff. A large authentic smoker prepares meat for over 10 hours. The beef brisket was decent, although a bit dry, and the fries were a bit oily and soggy. Also, the frappuccino didn't seem to contain blended ice.

Name: The Brunch House (Brasov)
Review: A decent brunch spot, although I would argue a bit overrated. The Pistachio cr√®me used in the Latte and Waffles was too thick and sickly. The star of the show was the spiced Romanian sausage (similar to Chorizo), and the side potatoes were tasty too. Unfortunately there wasn't much of a vibe in the upstairs room in which we were seated.

Name: Onda (Manchester)
Review: A spacious and well presented restaurant with very nice staff. A great selection of pastas and pizzettas, with the Beef Shin Ragu Mafaldine being the standout dish for me. Good affogato, with the authentic diamond-hole shaped gelato. Caffe Latte was too small.

Name: Alfi (London)
Review: A nice authentic carbonara, with al dente pasta, a perfect creamy sauce, and strips of guanciale which surprisingly wasn't too salty. Tiramisu was scooped generously tableside for us, but the ladyfinger layers were inconsistent in their soaking of espresso, with some parts a lot stronger than others.
